title: What caused South Africa’s energy crisis?
description: South Africa has declared a national disaster to tackle a dire energy crisis.

title: Turkey and Syria rescuers persist as death toll passes 25,000
description: Rescue operations impeded by insecurity in some areas as police in Turkey arrest dozens for looting.

title: After massive Turkey quakes, Istanbul residents fear the next one
description: Experts say studies suggest that a powerful earthquake is expected to hit Turkey's largest city soon.

title: Police arrest 15 after violent protest outside UK refugee hotel
description: The incident comes after increase in numbers of refugees and migrants crossing the Channel to the UK in boats.

title: Angry mob lynches man accused of blasphemy in Pakistan
description: The mob snatched the suspect from his prison cell and lynched him for allegedly desecrating pages of the Quran.

title: Can EU-Russia relations be repaired post-Putin?
description: Putin's decision-making has set Russia down a path that any successor would find difficult to turn from.

title: South African rapper AKA shot dead in Durban
description: Kiernan Forbes, 35, was killed with his close friend, Tebello 'Tibz' Motsoane, as they were walking towards their car.

title: Hans Modrow, East Germany’s last communist leader, dies at 95
description: Modrow was made prime minister in November 1989 - days after the fall of the Berlin Wall.

title: Iran’s Raisi takes aim at ‘enemies’ on revolution anniversary
description: Iran's president said criticism over human and women's rights should be aimed at the West and not Iran.

title: Turkey-Syria earthquake victims in race to survive
description: Emergency workers fight against time as poor weather conditions hinder desperate rescue and relief efforts.

title: US top envoy calls for ‘dialogue’ in rare call with Nicaragua FM
description: Blinken calls for dialogue in rare high-level contact between the countries, a day after 222 prisoners released.

title: Peru: A disconnect between protesters and press
description: Peruvians are protesting but what story is the media telling? Also, the dangers of dissent in Belarus.

title: Biden, Brazil’s Lula vow relationship reboot at White House meet
description: Leaders promise to work together on climate change, democracy, despite disagreements over Ukraine.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 353
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 353rd day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Can the EU compete with US and China as a hub for green products?
description: The European Union has drawn up a plan to boost the production of electric cars and renewable energy projects.

title: Five million may be homeless in Syria after quake: UN
description: UN official in Syria says the 'crisis within a crisis' is also making the delivery of aid more difficult.

title: Amin Salam: ‘Difficult to prove’ Lebanon is not a failed state
description: The Lebanese economy minister discusses the country's financial meltdown.

title: US blacklists six Chinese entities over spy balloon programme
description: The blacklisting will make it difficult for the companies and one research institute to obtain US technology exports.

title: Wagner mercenaries chief admits Russia facing Bakhmut resistance
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin has admitted Russian troops are engaged in a fierce fight to take the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut.

title: Iranian-French academic Fariba Adelkhah released from Iran prison
description: Fariba Adelkhah has been released from notorious Evin prison but it is unknown under what conditions she was freed.

title: UN human rights chief calls on international powers to help Haiti
description: Volker Turk ends a visit to Haiti with renewed calls for the international community to send forces to combat its gangs.

title: Spain offers citizenship to freed Nicaraguan political prisoners
description: The announcement comes after Nicaragua's legislature moved to strip the released prisoners of their citizenship.
